Package com.atakmap.android.gui.coordinateentry

Interface CoordinateEntryPane

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AddrPane, DDPane, DMPane, DMSPane, MGRSPane, UTMPane
    public interface CoordinateEntryPane
extends Disposable

        dispose

    • Method Detail

      • getUID

        java.lang.String getUID()
        Returns the uid associated with the CoordinateEntryCapability.
        Returns:
        the unique identifier

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the coordinate entry panel. This should be a human readable name that accurately describes the capability.
        Returns:
        the name of the coordinate entry panel

      • getView

        android.view.View getView()
        The graphical user experience used to enter the information or render the current geopoint
        Returns:
        the view that is inflated.

      • onActivate

        void onActivate​(@Nullable
                GeoPointMetaData currentPoint,
                boolean editable)
        Called when the pane is visible with the original point provided when the dialog is originally shown and the current point being used as a workspace. Can be called while the view is visible for example when the elevation is updated or when the display is cleared.
        Parameters:
        currentPoint - the new point based on the user manipulation. Please note that if the current point is NULL, then the expectation is that the is cleared.
        editable - if the original point is editable or not

      • getGeoPointMetaData

        GeoPointMetaData getGeoPointMetaData()
                              throws CoordinateEntryPane.CoordinateException
        The result of manipulation when the screen is no longer showing. This can be called when the user is changing the panels or when the overall coordinate entry dialog is dismissed.
        Returns:
        the geopoint that is a result of the human entry on the screen and can be null if not filled in or if there is an error with the human input.
        Throws:
        CoordinateEntryPane.CoordinateException - a coordinate exception if the current screen information cannot be turned into a geopoint.

      • autofill

        void autofill​(@Nullable
              GeoPointMetaData point)
        Autofill can be called to clear out the current entered information and fill in the most granular parts of the screen
        Parameters:
        point - the geopoint can be null

      • format

        java.lang.String format​(@Nullable
                        GeoPointMetaData point)
        Given a coordinate, produce a stringified representation of the geopoint based on the selected coordinate formatting rules without an altitude. This can be called no matter the current state of the pane and should not impact the current state of a displayed pane.
        Parameters:
        point - the geopoint to pass in - please note that this can be null
        Returns:
        a human readable string if one exists or null if none exists.

      • setOnChangedListener

        void setOnChangedListener​(CoordinateEntryPane.OnChangedListener onChangedListener)
        Sets a listener on the pane for when the current pane no longer matches the original input via human input.
        Parameters:
        onChangedListener - the on change listener.
